snippet: Donald J. Trump said that people on the lists should be barred from buying firearms, putting him at odds with the National Rifle Association, which has endorsed him.
abstract: Donald Trump says in Twitter message that people placed on terror watch list should not be allowed to buy firearms, position that puts him at odds with Republican Party and National Rifle Assn; statement com even as Democrats in Senate filibuster to protest failure to pass stronger gun safety measures over past several years.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Atlanta, Emmarie Huetteman from Washington, and Jonah Engel Bromwich from New York.

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump said that people on the lists should be barred from buying firearms, putting him at odds with the National Rifle Association, which has endorsed him.

headline.main: Trump Veers From Party Line on Gun Control
headline.print_headline: As Gun Control Debate Flares, Trump Veers From the Party Line
